resources.string: Small manual and infos about Inetify

Features 

Inetify runs in the background and notifies you about the status of internet connectivity when your device connects to a Wifi network. 

This can be useful if you have set up your device to automatically connect to a Wifi network that requires authentication on a web page ("captive portal"). 
In case you forget to authenticate, Inetify notifies you that there is no internet connectivity. 

You can also test internet connectivity manually, regardless of the type of data connection. 
Please note, that a test downloads data and thus can cause costs when using a mobile data connection. 
In the background, Inetify tests internet connectivity only when a Wifi connection was established. 

Functionality and Settings 

Inetify compares the title of the internet site set in the settings, by default www.google.com, with the page title specified in the settings, by default "Google". If the site cannot be reached at all or if the connection is forced to a captive portal, which most likely has a different than the expected title, internet connectivity is considered "Not OK" and a negative notification is given. 
If the title matches, internet connectivity is considered "OK" and a positive notification is given. 

In case the title of the internet site set in the settings changes, Inetify will give false negative notifications. If this happens, please check the title of the page and update the settings, or use another internet site which is unlikely to change its title. 
It is enough to specify a part of the title, and the comparison is case-insensitive.
